repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
DISCLAIMER: I don't know anything about cmake and am an idiot!! please roast me if this is wrong

Fixes #27193

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  This will format changed Lua, C, and treesitter query files with all appropriate flags set.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,7 +178,7 @@ make lint
 
 - You can format files by using:
   ```bash
-  make format  # or formatc, formatlua
+  make format  # or formatc, formatlua, formatquery
   ```
   This will format changed Lua and C files with all appropriate flags set.

comment_regular_data.body: Does this also include the format check?
I left it out because of the discrepancy between nvim-treesitter master and ts_query_ls, should I bring it in?
Yes, that discrepancy is not relevant for Neovim itself (both because you are targeting master here, and because the bundled queries are not affected by the match limit).
TODO note for myself: maybe give this the luals treatment of downloading it since no package manager will have this.

> TODO note for myself: maybe give this the luals treatment of downloading it since no package manager will have this.

Well, nixpkgs does ðŸ¤ª 

(And once this is merged, I intend to leverage it for another try in getting it added to homebrew.)

But I consider this like stylua (although not as stable): Easy to get off github, and exact version doesn't matter (as much as for other tools with notable behavior changes from version to version).

Note: If we add this (which I am in favor of), we should deprecate the built-in query linter to avoid having multiple sources of truth. First step (in this PR) would be to make the linter opt-in instead of opt-out.

> First step (in this PR) would be to make the linter opt-in instead of opt-out.

What concretely is needed? Want to unblock this

> What concretely is needed? Want to unblock this

Well, I guess first of all an executive decision on who "owns" the queries. If the answer is "nvim-treesitter" (i.e., all changes need to go through there), then arguably we don't need this check here (although it doesn't hurt) since this is already done in nvim-treesitter.

If the answer is "Neovim" (i.e., changes may be pulled from nvim-treesitter but independent changes are welcome), then this is very much needed.

The concrete change I was referring to was changing the default in this line
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a520d9c4eacb47dac2a3351c1d93ed06f3ad0d77/runtime/ftplugin/query.lua#L20

to `{}` (which I believe should be done in either case, as most people working on queries will want to use the much more featureful and performant external language server).

**EDIT:** #37941

> executive decision on who "owns" the queries. If the answer is "nvim-treesitter" (i.e., all changes need to go through there), then arguably we don't need this check here (although it doesn't hurt)

If we haven't extended/forked anything then we don't own it. If we do, then we should mention it in MAINTAIN.md. That is a 2-way door, i.e. we can revisit in the future if needed (though I don't expect to).

IIUC, one motivation for https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/27193 was to ensure we don't accidentally update a parser without also updating its queries? If so, then I assume we still want this CI check.

> If we haven't extended/forked anything then we don't own it. If we do, then we should mention it in MAINTAIN.md. That is a 2-way door, i.e. we can revisit in the future if needed (though I don't expect to).

This is a long-term strategy discussion that should be had at some point. Right now I am running a tight ship as a Neovim integration project, but I will not (be able to) maintain nvim-treesitter forever. My point is that I would strongly suggest avoiding the mess Vim got into with its syntax and ftplugin files where ownership is so diluted that changes are often blocked by giving the runaround.

In any case, that is not a discussion that blocks adding this check; it's harmless and quick, and as you say can prevent drive-by bump PRs (or me messing up a backport) if nothing else.

So I am in favor of adding this, pending a rebase and eyeballing by @dundargoc

> This is a long-term strategy discussion that should be had at some point.

Current status is in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/22313 

>  I would strongly suggest avoiding ... where ownership is so diluted that changes are often blocked by giving the runaround.

I think https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig is an approach that can work. Depending on the state of nvim-treesitter, we could either take ownership of it or reimplement it? Any other option I am missing?

> Current status is in #22313

That's more of a (valuable) pro/con collection (some of which are outdated)?

> > I would strongly suggest avoiding ... where ownership is so diluted that changes are often blocked by giving the runaround.
> 
> I think https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig is an approach that can work. Depending on the state of nvim-treesitter, we could either take ownership of it or reimplement it? Any other option I am missing?

Yes, that is one option, and probably the most feasible one given the technical short-term perspectives (in particular lack of progress in wasm support). 

In fact, over the last year or two I have worked hard (and eaten the hate for it) precisely to whittle nvim-treesitter into a shape that would make that a reasonable possibility. So no need for reimplementation; I'd be happy to transfer the repo if push comes to shove. (Which is likely some ways off; I just wanted to make sure to raise the issue well ahead of time.)
@clason remove the test commit then merge?
I wanted to give @dundargoc a chance for a look; if he doesn't have time right now I'll merge this before the weekend is over.
